revised_title: Thermal Diffusion in Inert Gas Mixtures: Temperature Dependence and Lennard-Jones Model
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on thermal diffusion in binary mixtures of inert gases, measuring the temperature dependence of the thermal diffusion ratio. The results indicate that the ratio generally increases with temperature and becomes constant at high temperatures. The findings support the Lennard-Jones model, which considers an inverse power repulsion superimposed on an attractive force, as a possible explanation for the observed behavior.
